title: Famous Japanese Restaurant-Style Salad Dressing Recipe
description: This Japanese salad dressing has lots of great taste sensations — garlic, ginger, minced celery, ketchup, soy sauce, lemon juice, vinegar, and oil.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Salad Dressing Recipes Famous Japanese Restaurant-Style Salad Dressing 4.3 (390) 319 Reviews 23 Photos This Japanese salad dressing is easy and flavorful. Submitted by MARBALET Updated on May 8, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 23 23 23 23 Prep Time: 10 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 14 Yield: 1 3/4 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 14 servings ½ cup minced onion ½ cup peanut oil ⅓ cup rice wine vinegar 2 tablespoons water 2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger root 2 tablespoons minced celery 2 tablespoons ketchup 4 teaspoons soy sauce 2 teaspoons white sugar 2 teaspoons lemon juice ½ teaspoon minced garlic ½ teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine minced onion, peanut oil, rice vinegar, water, ginger, celery, ketchup, soy sauce, sugar, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper in a blender. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Blend until all ingredients are well-pureed, about 30 seconds. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 484 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 82 Calories 8g Fat 3g Carbs 0g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 14 Calories 82 % Daily Value * Total Fat 8g 10% Saturated Fat 1g 7% Sodium 314mg 14% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 3g Protein 0g 0% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 3mg 0% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 28mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Famous Japanese Restaurant-Style Salad Dressing 01 of 23 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 23 Photo by  Becki Frett Najm 06/10/2020 03 of 23 Photo by  RiconKing 03/14/2020 04 of 23 Photo by  LissaM77 01/28/2020 Well, I followed recipe to the T...however, it tasted nothing like our local Japanese restaurant dressing. It may be good to some m, and I’m not downing the recipe at all, but it’s not for us. 05 of 23 Photo by  Renee Birk Gottlieb 05/18/2019 06 of 23 Photo by  Charline Mainprize 04/27/2019 Verry good. Try straining half of the mixture after blending and add half the onions. I like it to sit in the fridge with shredded carrots before using( 1 hour ) 07 of 23 Photo by  Malissa Gray 04/14/2019 Don't pay attention to the other reviews who complain about this recipe because this recipe tastes excellent and is definitely spot on. It tastes exactly like jasmine's. Will definitely make again. 08 of 23 Photo by  Mary Costanzo 04/12/2018 This came out amazing!!!! 09 of 23 Photo by  calconcel 02/08/2017 I didn't have any ketchup so I used 1.5 Tbsp of tomato paste. Next time I might add a little less rice wine vinegar to make it less tart. Just my preference. All in all this is a really great tasting, quick and easy recipe. 10 of 23 Photo by  Britt 06/06/2016 We made this exactly as listed, and the onion flavor was very powerful. The rice wine vinegar was a little too prominent as well. I think if we reduce the onion and increase the celery and add a bit more sugar then it will be great. Great place to start and easy to adjust since it's a simple recipe. I also agree that there is no reason the mince the ingredients (just cut small enough for measurement, the blender will take care of the rest). We used a white onion and all fresh ingredients. 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Japanese-Style Ginger Salad Dressing 171 Ratings Nona's Japanese Ume Dressing 5 Ratings Carrot Ginger Dressing and Dip 4 Ratings Japanese Dressing 2 Ratings Asian Ginger Dressing 497 Ratings Tangy Ginger Lime Salad Dressing 29 Ratings Creamy Soy-Ginger Dressing 40 Ratings Absolutely Fabulous Greek Salad Dressing 2,081 Ratings 10 Ginger Salad Dressing Recipes Korean-Style Salad Dressing 8 Ratings Creamy Cilantro Salad Dressing 25 Ratings Easy Sesame Dressing 25 Ratings Jesse's Ginger Salad Dressing 78 Ratings Soy-Sesame Dipping Sauce 13 Ratings Miso Sesame Dressing 67 Ratings Copycat Italian Salad Dressing 16 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
